unnormalised: **Telecom Sector Boosted by Rapid Fiber-to-Home Expansion**
normalised: telecom sector boosted by rapid fiber to home expansion

unnormalised: New Delhi, October 26, 2023 – India's telecommunications sector is experiencing significant growth, driven by the rapid deployment of Fiber-to-Home (FTTH) infrastructure across the nation. This expansion is bringing high-speed internet connectivity to millions of households, bridging the digital divide.
normalised: new delhi, october twenty six, two thousand and twenty three – India's telecommunications sector is experiencing significant growth, driven by the rapid deployment of fiber to home (F T T H) infrastructure across the nation. this expansion is bringing high speed internet connectivity to millions of households, bridging the digital divide.

unnormalised: Recent data indicates that over 500,000 new FTTH connections were established in the last quarter alone. Reliance Jio and Airtel are leading the charge, with substantial investments in laying fiber optic cables, particularly in Tier-II and Tier-III cities. The Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Delhi is also researching advanced fiber optic technologies to further enhance network performance.
normalised: recent data indicates that over five hundred thousand new F T T H connections were established in the last quarter alone. reliance jio and airtel are leading the charge, with substantial investments in laying fiber optic cables, particularly in tier two and tier three cities. the Indian institute of technology (I I T) delhi is also researching advanced fiber optic technologies to further enhance network performance.

unnormalised: Experts predict this trend will continue, fueled by increasing demand for bandwidth-intensive applications like streaming services and online education, mirroring the digital transformation depicted in movies like "Rocket Boys". The government's BharatNet project aims to connect all Gram Panchayats with high-speed internet, further accelerating FTTH adoption. Analysts estimate total FTTH investment this year will surpass Rs. 25,000 crore. This infrastructural push is projected to add 2% to India's GDP within the next 5 years.
normalised: experts predict this trend will continue, fueled by increasing demand for bandwidth intensive applications like streaming services and online education, mirroring the digital transformation depicted in movies like "rocket boys". the government's bharat net project aims to connect all gram panchayats with high speed internet, further accelerating F T T H adoption. analysts estimate total F T T H investment this year will surpass rupees twenty five thousand crore. this infrastructural push is projected to add two percent to India's G D P within the next five years.
